TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}
TEXT.source: told by Giłgiław of Vałulu village

S.FORM: ti Tjikunal kirimu a seman tjalupun tua sunat, sa tjalupunan nimadju.
ti Tjikonal kirimo a seman tjalopon toa sonat, sa tjaloponan nimadjo.
S.TRANSL: Tjikunal straightaway made a hat out of paper and put it on.

S.FORM: ka manu sikiqaiłungan, nasaregem aravats timadju.
ka mano sikiqailjongan, nasaregem aravac timadjo.
S.TRANSL: When he looked in the mirror he looked very splendid.

S.FORM: qau "nanguaq a kiqetsi aken tua tsumay," aya timadju.
qao "nangoaq a kiqeci aken toa comay," aya timadjo.
S.TRANSL: So he said: “I must go and hunt a bear.”

S.FORM: seman tjakit tua zaman sa pasivuluq tua qau timadju a sema kasasavan.
seman tjakit toa zaman sa pasivoloq toa qao timadjo a sema kasasavan.
S.TRANSL: He had miscanthus grass for a sword and held a bit of bamboo as a spear, and went out into the forecourt of the house.

S.FORM: manu patsun ti Kałikałi a kaka nimadju.
mano pacon ti Kaljikalji a kaka nimadjo.
S.TRANSL: His sibling Kałikałi saw him,

S.FORM: "uri kemuda sun, kaka?" aya kivadaq.
"ori kemoda son, kaka?" aya kivadaq.
S.TRANSL: and asked: “What are you going to do, brother?”

S.FORM: manu tevelain ni Tjikunal: "uri kiqetsi aken tua tsumay," aya.
mano tevelain ni Tjikonal: "ori kiqeci aken toa comay," aya.
S.TRANSL: Tjikunal answered: “I’m going to hunt a bear.”

S.FORM: qau "su sikuda zua zaman azua qau?" ayain ni Kałikałi.
qao "so sikoda zoa zaman azoa qao?" ayain ni Kaljikalji.
S.TRANSL: So Kałikałi said: “What are you doing with that grass and bamboo?”

S.FORM: "inika zaman, inika qau.
"inika zaman, inika qao.
S.TRANSL: He answered: “That’s not grass or bamboo;

S.FORM: ku tjakit aitsu, ku vuluq aitsu," aya temvela.
ko tjakit aico, ko voloq aico," aya temvela.
S.TRANSL: this is my sword and my spear.”

S.FORM: "iya, ui ḍi.
"iya, oi dri.
S.TRANSL: “Oh, I see.

S.FORM: pakianu aken, kaka," ayain ni Kałikałi.
pakiano aken, kaka," ayain ni Kaljikalji.
S.TRANSL: Take me with you, brother,” said Kałikałi.

S.FORM: manu kemim tiamadju tua tsumay.
mano kemim tiamadjo toa comay.
S.TRANSL: So they went looking for bears,

S.FORM: neka.
neka.
S.TRANSL: but didn’t find any.

S.FORM: qau "ainu anga, kaka, a tsumay?" aya ti Kałikałi.
qao "aino anga, kaka, a comay?" aya ti Kaljikalji.
S.TRANSL: So Kałikałi said: “Where are the bears, brother?”

S.FORM: "uzing anga, palamu anga," ayain ni Tjikunal.
"ozing anga, palamo anga," ayain ni Tjikonal.
S.TRANSL: “Over there; we’ll soon see them,” said Tjikunal.

S.FORM: manu ka tsuay a pagału tevuta zua niamadju a ngiaw.
mano ka coay a pagaljo tevota zoa niamadjo a ngiaw.
S.TRANSL: After quite a time their cat emerged.

S.FORM: "aku tja ngiaw, kaka.
"ako tja ngiaw, kaka.
S.TRANSL: “Why, it’s our cat, brother.

S.FORM: maya qemtsiqetsi," aya ti Kałikałi.
maya qemciqeci," aya ti Kaljikalji.
S.TRANSL: Don’t kill it,” said Kałikałi.

S.FORM: łakua sipatsiłik sakamaya ni Tjikunal sa laingi.
ljakoa sipaciljik sakamaya ni Tjikonal sa laingi.
S.TRANSL: But Tjikunal just raised his weapons and chased it.

S.FORM: ti Kałikałi "maya maya, a tja ngiaw, kaka, semalimsim," aya a patjavilivilił.
ti Kaljikalji "maya maya, a tja ngiaw, kaka, semalimsim," aya a patjavilivililj.
S.TRANSL: Kałikałi followed him saying: “Don’t don’t; it’s our cat, brother; the poor thing.”

S.FORM: ka ika makalaing ti Tjikunal, semutjalupun anga sa veritsan anga a zaman a qau a djinadjas, sa tjumaq anga.
ka ika makalaing ti Tjikonal, semotjalopon anga sa verican anga a zaman a qao a djinadjas, sa tjomaq anga.
S.TRANSL: When Tjikunal failed to catch up with the cat, he took off his hat and threw away the grass and bamboo he had been holding, and went indoors.

S.FORM: manu pakatjaraitan nua kina tua vurasi a kinuław tiamadju a marekaka.
mano pakatjaraitan noa kina toa vorasi a kinoljaw tiamadjo a marekaka.
S.TRANSL: So their mother gave the siblings a roasted sweet potato each.

S.FORM: ka kemakan tiamadju.
ka kemakan tiamadjo.
S.TRANSL: While they were eating,

S.FORM: mangtjez azua ngiaw niamadju; łakua seqałanga sakamaya, ika ui anga a łiadet.
mangtjez azoa ngiaw niamadjo; ljakoa seqaljanga sakamaya, ika oi anga a ljiadet.
S.TRANSL: their cat came in; but it was very shy and wouldn’t go near them.

S.FORM: "qau pai pasedjaluu, kaka, a tja ngiaw," ayain anga ni Kałikałi ti Tjikunal.
"qao pai pasedjaloo, kaka, a tja ngiaw," ayain anga ni Kaljikalji ti Tjikonal.
S.TRANSL: Kałikałi said to Tjikunal: “Make friends with our cat, brother.”

S.FORM: sa pasedjalu-i anga, sana łiadedet, sana kakan tua sinitseviq ni Tjikunal.
sa pasedjalo-i anga, sana ljiadedet, sana kakan toa siniceviq ni Tjikonal.
S.TRANSL: So he made friends with it, and then it came near and ate the bits of food which Tjikunal broke off for it.
